variables.name: HHFORMULATION_RHS
variables.description: Keyword to add the variable-density head formulation terms to the right-hand side of the flow equation.
variables.tooltip: When specified, the density-dependent head terms are placed on the right-hand side of the equation rather than in the coefficient matrix. This produces a symmetric matrix that can be solved with CG instead of BICGSTAB, potentially improving performance.

blocks.name: DIMENSIONS
blocks.description: Dimensions defining the number of density species.

variables.name: NRHOSPECIES
variables.description: Number of species used to calculate fluid density.
variables.tooltip: The total number of chemical species that contribute to fluid density variations. Each species has its own density-concentration relationship defined in PACKAGEDATA.

blocks.name: PACKAGEDATA
blocks.description: Density species data defining the relationship between concentration and fluid density.

variables.name: IRHOSPEC
variables.tooltip: Unique identifier for each density species, numbered from 1 to NRHOSPECIES.

variables.name: DRHODC
variables.description: Slope of the density-concentration relationship (change in density per unit change in concentration).
variables.tooltip: The linear coefficient relating concentration change to density change: rho = rho_ref + DRHODC * (C - CRHOREF). For seawater, DRHODC is approximately 0.7143 kg/m3 per kg/m3 of TDS.

variables.name: CRHOREF
variables.description: Reference concentration for the density-concentration relationship.
variables.tooltip: The concentration at which the fluid density equals the reference density. Typically set to 0 for freshwater. For seawater problems, this is the freshwater concentration.

variables.name: MODELNAME
variables.description: Name of the GWT (Groundwater Transport) model providing concentration values.
variables.tooltip: The name of the transport model that computes concentrations for this species. Must match a GWT model name defined in the simulation name file.

variables.name: AUXSPECIESNAME
variables.description: Name of the auxiliary variable in the GWF model that contains concentration values for this species.
variables.tooltip: Alternative to MODELNAME. Specifies the name of an auxiliary variable in a GWF stress package that contains concentration values. Use this when concentrations are provided directly rather than by a transport model.
